author: Franklin Ma
comment: For some reason, the lastest update break my default Nexus fingerprint gestures. Other than that I absolutely love this app and recommend it to countless people at work. Thanks for the great work!! Keep it up! 🙂

reply.author: ArloSoft
reply.content: The next update will.seperate fingerprint support into its own accessibility service so you can disable this and continue to use other accessibility services.

author: Harry Matthys
comment: Congratulations to the developer. This is a very helpful application. One has to get to understand the concept first. This is easily achieved by reading the help file, trial and error, and/or looking at the available templates. Once you have written your first macro, you just can't stop. The free version is restricted to five macros. Purchasing the app at a reasonable price (my opinion) unlocks unlimited macros. It is money well spent. I've bought junk apps for considerably more. So, go for this one, and enjoy your Android phone on a whole different level. There are other apps out there that claims to be able to do what this app can do. However, the proof of the pudding is in the eating. You decide for yourself. My mind is made up.

author: Samuel Beshai
comment: Not as capable as some other apps but so easy to use which is why it's my favourite automation app. I'd recommend to anyone who finds themselves doing things repeatedly such as playing Spotify when they connect to their car Bluetooth.  The templates are really handy too when you're not sure what you want.
